meanings.definition: A type of coarse woolen cloth used for making clothing.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother made me a warm jacket out of stroud.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used stroud to create a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled paint on my stroud jacket!
meanings.sent4: Her stroud coat was a shield against the cold wind.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the stroud fabric caught everyone's eye.

meanings.sent1: Stroud is a charming town with friendly locals.
meanings.sent2: Many tourists visit Stroud to explore its historic buildings.
meanings.sent3: In Stroud, even the pigeons seem to have British accents!
meanings.sent4: The heart of Stroud beats with the rhythm of its people.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of Stroud's landscape is truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A type of raincoat made of waterproof material.
meanings.sent1: I always carry my stroud in case it rains.
meanings.sent2: Her bright yellow stroud kept her dry during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The ducks envy my stylish stroud!
meanings.sent4: His stroud was a shield against the downpour of rain.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on my stroud was oddly soothing.
